data.title: DraftKings is coming to Arkansas as its reach hits 30 U.S. states
data.description:
DraftKings (DKNG) is set to launch in Arkansas after the Arkansas Racing Commission approved the company for licensure. The sports betting giant will go live in the state through a market access agreement with Southland Casino Hotel, pending final regulatory approvals. 

While Arkansas online sports betting itself has been live since 2022 via locally branded platforms such as Betly, BetSaracen, and Oaklawn Sports, national online sports betting companies have been hesitant to enter the state because of the 51% revenue-share requirement that is still in place. Arkansas mandates that any third-party mobile sportsbook deal must give at least 51% of net sports betting revenue to the in-state casino partner.

The addition of Arkansas expands the access of DraftKings Sportsbook to more than 2 million adult residents in the state, increasing coverage of the product to 53% of the U.S. population. Arkansas will be the 30th U.S. state, in addition to Washington, D.C., Ontario, Canada, and Puerto Rico, where DraftKings operates regulated sports betting.

Shares of DraftKings (DKNG) were down 2.6% in premarket trading.

data.title: Delek Logistics Partners GAAP EPS of $0.88 misses by $0.24, revenue of $255.7M misses by $27.94M
data.description:
• Delek Logistics Partners press release (DKL): Q4 GAAP EPS of $0.88 misses by $0.24.
  • Revenue of $255.7M (+21.8% Y/Y) misses by $27.94M.
  • Delivered record financial performance, Adjusted EBITDA of $142.3 million for the fourth quarter and $535.6 million for the year
  • Progressed comprehensive acid gas injection (AGI) & sour gas treating solution at the Libby Gas Complex
  • Initiated 2026 EBITDA Guidance of $520 - 560 million
  • 2026 guidance reflects Increased economic separation from DK, as third-party EBITDA contribution to exceed 80%
  • Continued our consistent distribution growth with our 52nd consecutive quarterly increase to $1.125/unit

data.title: Retailers start to return to Chicago's Magnificent Mile as leasing recovery continues
data.description:
A number of high-profile retailers have returned to Chicago's Magnificent Mile, and leasing activity is clearly picking up, although the corridor still has vacancy rates well above the pre-COVID levels. Vacancy, which peaked at around roughly 34% in 2023, has since fallen into the low- to high-20s percentage range depending on the specific stretch of Michigan Avenue, signaling meaningful backfilling of space.

Analysts project retail leasing volume on Michigan Avenue could roughly double in 2026, with more than 100,000 square feet of absorption expected, suggesting that the rebound is moving into a more active phase as the deals signed in 2024–2025 begin to open.

New and returning tenants include fashion and specialty retailers such as Mango, Uniqlo, Aritzia, Alo Yoga, Intimissimi, and The North Face, which are opening or relocating flagship-style stores along the avenue and helping to restore some of its historic appeal as a national and international brand corridor. Meanwhile, Gap (GAP) is in advanced talks to lease about 8,325 square feet on Michigan Avenue. Larger multi-story boxes that were particularly difficult to lease after the pandemic and crime issues are increasingly being taken by experiential users, including a Harry Potter-themed interactive store/exhibit and other immersive or technology-driven attractions aimed at tourists and families.

Analysts think if the recovery extends, the Magnificent Mile's vacancy could move into the mid-teens by around 2027–2028 and potentially below 10% by 2030, implying a long but improving trajectory rather than a sharp snapback.

data.title: Docebo GAAP EPS of $0.91 beats by $0.61, revenue of $63.04M beats by $0.42M
data.description:
• Docebo press release (DCBO): Q4 GAAP EPS of $0.91 beats by $0.61.
  • Revenue of $63.04M (+10.5% Y/Y) beats by $0.42M.

Financial Outlook

Docebo is providing financial guidance for the three months ending March 31, 2026 as follows:

  • Total revenue between $63.5 million and $63.7 million
  • Adjusted EBITDA between $10.3 million to $10.5 million

Docebo is providing financial guidance for the fiscal year ending December 31, 2026 as follows:

  • Subscription revenue between $251.5 million and $253.5 million
  • Total revenue between $267.5 million and $269.5 million
  • Adjusted EBITDA between $52.5 million and $54.5 million

data.title: Markets AM Need to Know: South Korea market crash warning, ASML high-volume tools ready, and more
data.description:
Stock index futures were lower on Friday as traders kept a keen eye on the wholesale inflation report due today.

Now, here are five news stories that broke overnight to watch out for:

ASML high-volume tools ready: ASML Holding’s (ASML) next-generation chipmaking machine is now ready for manufacturers to bring into high-volume production, a senior executive told Reuters. The Dutch company produces the world’s only commercial extreme ultraviolet lithography tools, which are critical equipment for chipmakers. The new tool will help manufacturers such as Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing (TSM) and Intel (INTC) produce more powerful and efficient chips by eliminating several costly and complex steps from the chip-manufacturing process.

Lenders exposed to MFS collapse: Barclays (BCS), Banco Santander (SAN), and Wells Fargo (WFC) are among the Wall Street lenders exposed to failed UK mortgage finance firm Market Financial Solutions, according to Bloomberg News. Apollo Global Management’s (APO) Atlas SP Partners unit, Jefferies Financial Group (JEF), and Castlelake LP, which is majority owned by Brookfield (BN), are also reportedly exposed to MFS.

South Korea market crash warning: Former J.P. Morgan strategist Marko Kolanovic warned Thursday that the high-flying South Korean stock market could crash as soon as its next trading session. The KOSPI (KOSPI) (EWY) is up 175% since its April low and has seen unprecedented rapid point gains driven largely by two stocks: Samsung (SSNLF) and SK Hynix (HXSC.F).

Venezuelan oil revenue growth: Sales of Venezuelan oil under the flagship supply agreement with the United States are expected to reach $2 billion by the end of February, U.S. Energy Secretary Chris Wright told reporters in Texas on Thursday. The deal, which began after U.S. forces captured President Nicolás Maduro in early January, gives Washington control over Venezuela’s oil exports, with proceeds directed into a U.S.-supervised fund in Qatar.

Anthropic stands firm against DoD: Anthropic (ANTHRO) said Thursday that the company “cannot in good conscience” allow the Department of Defense to use its models in all lawful use cases without limitation, adding that the agency’s threats do not change its position. CEO Dario Amodei stated that while it is the department's prerogative to select contractors most aligned with their vision, the company hopes they reconsider given the substantial value Anthropic’s technology provides to armed forces.

data.title: BrightSpring Health Services beats Q4 street views
data.description:
• BrightSpring Health Services press release (BTSG): Q4 GAAP EPS of $0.35 beats by $0.05.
  • Revenue of $3.55B (+16.4% Y/Y) beats by $170M.
  • Gross profit of $413 million, up 21.8% compared to $339 million in the fourth quarter of 2024
  • Net income of $49.6 million compared to net income of $4.3 million in the fourth quarter of 2024
  • Adjusted EBITDA1 of $184 million, up 40.7% compared to $130 million in the fourth quarter of 2024
